comments.body: Exposing FilePos (and Seek) means than intrinsically RRawFile is thread unsafe.  This is likely 'fine' but we need to make sure that we document it (I.e. a thread safe file accessor would need to be build on to of it)
I don't follow..why would users expect that the same RRawFile can be used from multiple threads concurrently? That's never an implied guarantee.

We have a few request for TFile to be thread-safe.   Not being thread-safe means the client needs to do the lock explicitly (eg. TTree, RDataFrame, etc).  

Eitherway, it never hurts to be explicit :)
Thanks, clarified in the RRawFile class comment.
